instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.CHGR_ACIN: What is CHGR_ACIN? CHGR_ACIN is a signal that is created by a voltage divider between the charger and ground that goes into the ISL6258, ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip that creates PPBUS_G3H. It is necessary for SMC_BC_ACOK & CHGR_ACOK to be present so that the onewire circuit is told to turn on & allow the SMC to speak to the charger..
definitions.CHGR_BMON: What is CHGR_BMON? CHGR_BMON goes between the ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 that charges the battery & creates PPBUS_G3H and the SMC(system management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip) and provides current sensing information on battery charging to the SMC. If diagnostics reveal an off reading or failure with the charger current sense, this is a good place to start troubleshooting..
definitions.CHGR_AMON: What is CHGR_AMON? CHGR_AMON provides DC current sense information to the SMC(System management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip). It comes from the battery charging chip that controls the laptop charger, battery charging, and creation of PPBUS_G3H(ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip depending on the logic board part number and model). This is used for sensors. If a DC current sense sensor is reading off in diagnostics, this is a place to start looking. .
definitions.CHGR_ACOK: What is CHGR_ACOK? This is identical to SMC_BC_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.CHGR_PHASE: What is CHGR_PHASE? CHGR_PHASE is charger voltage chopped up into individual slices prior to smoothing where it becomes PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.CHGR_CSO_N: What is CHGR_CSO_N? CHGR_CSO_N is one of the current sense lines for the battery. Resistance between CHGR_CSO_N and CHGR_CSO_P should be the resistance should be the total series resistance of the current sense resistors in the circuit, usually about 2.2 ohms.
definitions.SMBUS_CHGR_SDA: What is SMBUS_CHGR_SDA? SMBUS_CHGR_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED..
definitions.CHGR_CSO_P: What is CHGR_CSO_P? CHGR_CSO_P is one of the current sense lines for the battery. Resistance between CHGR_CSO_P and CHGR_CSO_N should be the resistance should be the total series resistance of the current sense resistors in the circuit, usually about 2.2 ohms.
definitions.CHGR_CSI_N: What is CHGR_CSI_N? CHGR_CSI_N is one of the current sense lines for the charger. Resistance between CHGR_CSI_N and CHGR_CSI_P should be the resistance should be the total series resistance of the current sense resistors in the circuit, usually about 20.02 ohms.
definitions.CHGR_CSI_P: What is CHGR_CSI_P? CHGR_CSI_P is one of the current sense lines for the charger. Resistance between CHGR_CSI_P and CHGR_CSI_N should be the resistance should be the total series resistance of the current sense resistors in the circuit, usually about 20.02 ohms.
definitions.SMBUS_CHGR_SCL: What is SMBUS_CHGR_SCL? SMBUS_CHGR_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED..
definitions.CHGR_CELL: What is CHGR_CELL? CHGR_CELL is a signal going to the ISL6258, ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 battery charging chip that sets PPBUS_G3H voltage. Macbook Airs with 2 cells in series  in their batteries will have PPBUS_G3H voltages of 8.15v to 8.55v, Macbooks & Macbook Pros with 3 cells in series in their batteries will have PPBUS_G3H voltages of 12.23 to 12.56v..

threads.title: LIST of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> PINS
threads.message:
Thought it might be helpful when posting:

[FONT=Calibri][B]<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>/ <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 1: <SIGNAL>CHGR_AGATE</SIGNAL>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 2: <SIGNAL>PPCHGR_DCIN</SIGNAL> [/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 3: <SIGNAL>CHGR_ACIN</SIGNAL>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 4: <SIGNAL>CHGR_VFRQ</SIGNAL>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 5: <SIGNAL>CHGR_ICOMP</SIGNAL>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 6: <SIGNAL>CHGR_CELL</SIGNAL>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 7: <SIGNAL>CHGR_VCOMP</SIGNAL>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 8: <SIGNAL>CHGR_VNEG</SIGNAL>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 9: <SIGNAL>CHGR_AMON</SIGNAL>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 10: <SIGNAL>SMBUS_CHGR_SDA</SIGNAL> [/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 11: <SIGNAL>SMBUS_CHGR_SCL</SIGNAL>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 12: <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H_CHGR</SIGNAL>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 13: <SIGNAL>CHGR_RST_L</SIGNAL>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 14: <SIGNAL>CHGR_ACOK</SIGNAL>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 15: <SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 16: <SIGNAL>CHGR_BGATE</SIGNAL>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 17: <SIGNAL>CHGR_CSO_N</SIGNAL>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 18: <SIGNAL>CHGR_CSO_P</SIGNAL>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 19: <SIGNAL>PP5V1_CHGR_VDD</SIGNAL>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 20: <SIGNAL>PP5V1_CHGR_VDDP</SIGNAL>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 21: <SIGNAL>CHGR_LGATE</SIGNAL>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 22: PGND[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 23: <SIGNAL>CHGR_PHASE</SIGNAL>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 24: <SIGNAL>CHGR_UGATE</SIGNAL>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 25: <SIGNAL>CHGR_BOOT</SIGNAL>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 26: <SIGNAL>CHGR_SGATE</SIGNAL>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 27: <SIGNAL>CHGR_CSI_N</SIGNAL>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 28: <SIGNAL>CHGR_CSI_P</SIGNAL>[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]PIN 29: (AGND)<SIGNAL>THRM_PAD</SIGNAL>


I also found this helpful to study an example:[/B][/FONT]

[URL="https://www.it-tech.com.au/mac-q-a/macbook-power-up-sequences/"]https://www.it-tech.com.au/mac-q-a/m...-up-sequences/[/URL]

threads.title: LIST of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> PINS
threads.message:
I don't really understand why did you list ALL <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> pins!
Not all of them need to be measured; depends of symptom.
Also each pin has assigned its function on the schematic.

However, the link is usefull for many people I suppose...

threads.title: LIST of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> PINS
threads.message:
More of a copy and paste to make it easier.
May not need all of them

I found myself needing it just to make notes
